FY25 Results:J.K. Cement announced its FY25 results, reporting a net profit of ₹872 Cr and declared a final dividend of ₹15 per share.

Q4 FY25 Results:The company reported a consolidated net profit of ₹361.33 crore, a 64.5% increase compared to the same period last year.

Revenue:Consolidated revenue from operations for Q4 FY25 stood at ₹3,581.18 Cr, and for the full year FY25, it was ₹12,052.10 Cr.

JK Cement plans a greenfield expansion with an investment of ₹4,805 crore to add 7 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) to its production capacity. This includes new clinkerisation and grinding facilities in Rajasthan and Punjab. The company aims to reach a total production of 50 MTPA by 2030.

The company launched Portland Calcined Clay Limestone Cement (LC-3), a low-carbon cement product that can reduce CO2 emissions by up to 40%.

Key appointments include Bhumika Sood as the new Company Secretary and Compliance Officer (effective Nov 1, 2025), Raghav Moreshwar Tare as Group Financial Controller (effective Aug 1, 2025), and Neeraj Singhal as Head Internal Audit & Risk Compliance (effective Aug 1, 2025).

JK Cement acquired a majority stake in Saifco Cements in June 2025. The company also declared a final dividend of ₹15 per share for FY25. Market sentiment on the stock was reported as very bullish in August 2025.
